Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lynronne-1 (predicted AMPs;  UCLL, XXA; More AMPs?)
Sequence Information.Source: AI predicted, bacteriocin, bacteria; plant-attached rumen microbiome; plant microbiota

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the unmodified sequence of this peptide shows 40% similarity toTemporin-CPa.Activity: Active against bacteria S. aureus(MIC 8-32 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), A. baumannii and 14 clinical strains (MIC 4-16 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (16-64 ug/ml), C. jejuni (4-64 ug/ml), E. coli K12 (MIC 32 ug/ml), S. typhimurium (MIC 32 ug/ml), E. faecalis (MIC 32 ug/ml) and L. monocytogenes (MIC 32 ug/ml). Also inhibited biofilm formation:bacteria and disrupted to some extent 48-h preformed biofilms.Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:A. baumannii (150 mM), CaCl2-sensitive:A. baumannii (2.5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:A. baumannii (1 mM), KCl-insensitive:A. baumannii (4.5 mM),  NH4Cl-insensitive:A. baumannii (6 uM), ZnCl2-insensitive:A. baumannii (8 uM), and FeCl3-insensitive:A. baumannii (4 uM).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 30 mM SDS (Alexander et al., 2024).MOA:bacteria:A. baumannii DSM 30007:: at 4xMIC showed a strong membrane permeation.Resistance development:yes:bacteria:A. baumannii: A. baumannii DSM 30007 developed some resistance to this peptide in a 28 multiple passage experiment (MIC increased 8 fold).In vitro toxicity: it showed poor cytotoxicity to multiple cell lines (CC50 >184 ug/ml), including RBC (HC50 286 ug/ml).In vivo toxicity: didn't appear to be toxic to Galleria mellonella (90% survied at 8xMIC).Updated 10/2024
Literature Information.Author: Oyama LB, Girdwood SE, Cookson AR, Fernandez-Fuentes N, Priv√© F, Vallin HE, Wilkinson TJ, Golyshin PN, Golyshina OV, Mikut R, Hilpert K, Richards J, Wootton M, Edwards JE, Maresca M, Perrier J, Lundy FT, Luo Y, Zhou M, Hess M, Mantovani HC, Creevey CJ, Huws SA.2017
Literature Information.Title: The rumen microbiome: an underexplored resource for novel antimicrobial discovery
